ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'

about.summary: The maybe type represents the possibility of some value or nothing. It is often used instead of throwing an error or returning `NULL`. The advantage of using a maybe type over `NULL` is that it is both composable and requires the developer to explicitly acknowledge the potential absence of a value, helping to avoid the existence of unexpected behaviour.

The maybe type represents the possibility of some value or nothing. It is often used instead of throwing an error or returning `NULL`. The advantage of using a maybe type over `NULL` is that it is both composable and requires the developer to explicitly acknowledge the potential absence of a value, helping to avoid the existence of unexpected behaviour.

name: r-maybe
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.1.0" %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-maybe
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/maybe_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/maybe/maybe_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 14b2b6ba51cbe79edc2d6396fefeef710f2571ea10a408d21983d00f198d5285

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic

  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip  # [win]

  host:
    - r-base
    - r-magrittr

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-magrittr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('maybe')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('maybe')\""  # [win]


about:
  home: https://github.com/armcn/maybe
  doc_url: https://armcn.github.io/maybe/
  license: MIT
  summary: The maybe type represents the possibility of some value or nothing. It is often used instead of throwing an error or returning `NULL`. The advantage of using a maybe type over `NULL` is that it is both composable and requires the developer to explicitly acknowledge the potential absence of a value, helping to
    avoid the existence of unexpected behaviour.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - thewchan

The advantage of using a maybe type over `NULL` is that it is both composable and requires the developer to explicitly acknowledge the potential absence of a value, helping to avoid the existence of unexpected behaviour.
